availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Francis Henry Hughes, of Henderson, Kentucky, was an attorney for the law firm Hughes, Dallam, and Hughes. He served as the chancery pleader. He took part in a meeting swearing loyalty to the Union in November 1860.

bibl.p: History of Union County, Kentucky. A Complete Account of the Settlement, Organization and Government of the County, Together with Facts and Figures Concerning the Society, Professions, Commerce, Industries, Agriculture, Coal, Railroads, Education, Religion, and Other Institutions and Recources of the County and Biographical Sketches of its Leading Citizens (Evansville, In: Courier Co., Printers, Binders and Engravers, 1886), 193.
